en: Interview with Stacia Martin-West, professor with the College of Social Work at the University of Tennessee. Martin-West discusses her research focused on unconditional cash transfers provided to survivors of the wildfires. She also discusses the perceptions surrounding these transfers. Conducted over Zoom due to the COVID-19 pandemic. This is a representative quote from the interview: What we saw though, after the one year mark, is that most of the individuals that had been homeowners previously were able to purchase new residences--residence or they were able to rebuild, or those that had previously been in apartments were able to start renting again. And so, I think just looking at that in itself is a success, right.

Interview with Stacia Martin-West, professor with the College of Social Work at the University of Tennessee. Martin-West discusses her research focused on unconditional cash transfers provided to survivors of the wildfires. She also discusses the perceptions surrounding these transfers. Can you state your name and tell us your role at the university?
What were your general research areas before the wildfires?
When you mention unconditional cash tranfers, does this usually happen after a disaster? Can you talk about when these transfers take place?
Can you tell us about your experiences in the time leading up to the wildfires?
What was your experience like personally and professionally during the fire? What point did you begin thinking about the research opportunity?
How did you go about designing the scope of your research and the methodology?
Can you tell us how the My People Fund was run?
What were some of the other impacts?
Did you see any of the negative connotations to the unconditional cash transfers?
What were some of the other outcomes you found in this study?
After six months, each family received $11,000, did the families see this as having a positive impact?
How do you think this research could affect your discipline's understanding?
After COVID-19, across America, families are receiving unconditional cash transfers, can you talk about the similarities?
Is there anything else we haven't discussed that you would like to mention?

seo.title: Interview with Stacia Martin-West, 2020-04-23 - Rising From the Ashes Oral Histories
